[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Network: Connection Hijacking] Can an attacker hijack an existing stream connection to inject malicious transactions or status messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Network: Man-in-the-Middle] Without TLS/authentication, can MITM attackers modify transaction data or chain_id in transit? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Network: Replay at Transport Layer] Can captured gRPC messages be replayed at the transport layer to cause duplicate transaction processing? (High)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Batch: Size Limit] Is there a maximum batch size to prevent a single batch from containing millions of transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Batch: Processing Atomicity] If processing fails mid-batch, is the entire batch rolled back atomically, or can partial application occur? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Batch: Commit Timing] Is there a time limit for how long a batch can remain uncommitted between Data and BATCH_END? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Chain ID: u32 Range] Can chain_id overflow or wrap around if chain ID numbering exceeds u32::MAX? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Chain ID: Conflict] If two chains accidentally have the same chain_id, can transactions be replayed across chains? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Chain ID: Dynamic Change] Can chain_id be changed via governance, and if so, how is backward compatibility maintained with old streams? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Arithmetic: Batch Size Calculation] When computing batch size as (end_version - start_version + 1), can underflow occur if end_version < start_version? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Arithmetic: Version Increment] When incrementing to the next batch (prev_end_version + 1), can overflow occur at u64::MAX boundary? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Arithmetic: Cumulative Count] When summing transactions_count across multiple batches, can cumulative overflow cause incorrect total counts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Error: Deserialization Failure] If Transaction deserialization fails for one transaction in the batch, is the entire batch rejected or just that transaction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Error: Invalid Status Transition] If an invalid StatusType transition occurs (e.g., BATCH_END -> INIT without new stream), how is recovery handled? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Error: Timeout Handling] If no messages are received for an extended period, does the stream timeout and cleanup properly? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Access Control: Peer Verification] Is the identity of the requesting peer verified before serving transaction data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Access Control: Version Access] Can clients request arbitrary historical versions, or should access be restricted based on peer trustworthiness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Access Control: Rate Limiting Per Peer] Is there per-peer rate limiting to prevent a compromised peer from overloading the node? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Sync: Fast Sync Attack] Can an attacker providing fast-sync data via this protocol serve malicious transactions to unsynchronized nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Sync: Checkpoint Verification] Are there checkpoints or state proofs to verify that the streamed transactions match the canonical chain? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Sync: Fork Resolution] If multiple peers provide different transaction data for the same versions, how is fork resolution handled? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Advanced: Version Rollback] Can a malicious node cause a version rollback by serving older transaction history with higher version numbers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Advanced: Selective Censorship] Can a streaming node selectively omit certain transactions from batches while maintaining valid version ranges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Advanced: Transaction Reordering] Within a batch with valid version range, can transaction order be manipulated to cause different execution outcomes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Advanced: Split Brain Attack] Can inconsistent transaction streams to different clients cause network-wide state divergence? (Critical)
